𝗠𝗨𝗦𝗜𝗔𝗟𝗜𝗭𝗘𝗥 | Creating beautiful music visualizations and rendering high-quality videos of them.  🌟 Rising Fast!

⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 💻 C 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Creating beautiful music visualizations and rendering high-quality videos of them.
📅 Created: Aug 2023 • Updated: Apr 2025

⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Music visualization
✅ High-quality video rendering
✅ Support for multiple audio formats (wav, ogg, mp3, qoa, xm, mod, flac)
✅ Custom build system (nob)
✅ Hot reloading


⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 1.1K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 111 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 23 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Musializer is a tool for creating music visualizations and rendering high-quality videos. It supports multiple audio formats and features a custom build system called `nob`. The project also offers hot reloading capabilities for faster development and experimentation.

⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃⁃

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/tsoding/musializer

🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Applying a dark theme to websites for comfortable nighttime viewing, particularly beneficial for OLED screens.
📅 Created: Apr 2025 • Updated: Apr 2025

▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫

✅ Pitch black theme for websites
✅ High contrast for easy reading at night
✅ Site-specific themes
✅ Whitelist management
✅ Automatic scheduling
✅ React-based dynamic rendering


▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫▫

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

The Chrome OLED Mode extension provides a pitch-black theme for websites, enhancing readability in low-light conditions. It utilizes React for dynamic rendering and offers features like site-specific themes, whitelist management, and automatic scheduling. The extension aims to provide a superior dark mode experience compared to alternatives.

The hacker-laws repository serves as a curated collection of essential laws, theories, principles, and patterns for developers and technologists. It offers a comprehensive reference guide, covering a wide range of topics in software development and computer science, making it a valuable resource for understanding fundamental concepts and best practices.

Ink Kit is an SDK designed to streamline onchain application development. It provides developers with ready-to-use app layout templates, vibrant themes, and animated components, all designed to create polished and engaging user interfaces. The SDK aims to improve the developer experience by offering customizable and efficient tools for building onchain applications.

Inbox Zero is an open-source AI email assistant and client designed to help users efficiently manage their inbox. It offers features like AI-powered email management, reply tracking, smart categorization, bulk unsubscribing, cold email blocking, and email analytics, all aimed at reducing time spent on email and achieving inbox zero.

✅ Nested folder organization
✅ Offline availability

Saber is a cross-platform, open-source handwriting notes application designed for simplicity and intuitive use. It offers unique features such as note inversion for comfortable dark mode usage, a dual-password system for enhanced security, and a highlighting tool that avoids common rendering issues. Saber allows users to organize notes with nested folders and is available on various platforms, including Android, iOS, Linux, Windows, and macOS.

Dagger is an open-source runtime designed for composable workflows, making it ideal for AI agents and CI/CD pipelines. It offers features like containerized execution, a universal type system, automatic caching, and built-in observability. Dagger aims to provide a platform-agnostic solution for building and running complex applications with repeatability and modularity.

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 📘 TypeScript 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Visualizing and understanding the structure of GitHub repositories.

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Instant Visualization of GitHub repositories as system design diagrams
✅ Interactive navigation to source files and directories
✅ Fast diagram generation powered by AI
✅ Customizable diagram generation
✅ API Access for integration

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

GitDiagram transforms GitHub repositories into interactive system design diagrams, enabling users to quickly visualize and understand the codebase structure. It offers features like instant visualization, interactive navigation, AI-powered diagram generation, and customization options, making it easier to explore and contribute to open-source projects.

𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧𝗦𝗠𝗘𝗢𝗪 | Enabling Go applications to interact with the WhatsApp web multidevice API.  📈 Growing!

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐹 Go 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Enabling Go applications to interact with the WhatsApp web multidevice API.
📅 Created: Oct 2021 • Updated: Apr 2025

╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌╌

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Sending messages to private chats and groups (text and media)
✅ Receiving all messages
✅ Managing groups and receiving group change events
✅ Joining via invite messages, using and creating invite links
✅ Sending and receiving typing notifications
✅ Sending and receiving delivery and read receipts
✅ Reading and writing app state (contact list, chat pin/mute status, etc)
✅ Sending and handling retry receipts if message decryption fails
✅ Sending status messages

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Whatsmeow is a Go library that provides comprehensive access to the WhatsApp web multidevice API. It allows Go developers to send and receive messages, manage groups, handle various event types, and manage app state, making it easier to integrate WhatsApp functionality into Go applications.
